result.execSummary:
The defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.
Court orderd defendant to pay all  mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 9/23/2022.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ebony Lavonne Smith

records.addlTxt:
AS TO 3/23/2022 Sentencing:
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
Court WAIVED all non mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court ordered Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during by 9/23/2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ebony Lavonne Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 45 in the House of Correction, credit of 45 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ebony Lavonne Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Received and Filed. Updated Pretrial Incarceration Credit

11:58 AM Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.  Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Due to incelment weather and confusion regarding court hearings, Defense request an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 30 - via zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Addendum

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Aldi, 6700 W. Capitol Dr., Milwaukee WI 53216
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Ebony Lavonne Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ebony Lavonne Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
